DataElement.preferredName: Other Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality Present Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe another cytogenetic abnormality found via fluorescence in situ hybridization.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Other Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Other Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.:An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly._Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
